headline.main: KANSAS SKETCHES.; Incidents and Observations of a Trip to Kansas.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following letter, written by a gentleman of this City, and embodying the results of his personal experience and observervation during at trip in the early part of the Summer to Kansas,--although its publication has been a long time delayed,--contains many things which will still be read with interest:

headline.main: SENATOR SUMNER'S RECEPTION IN BOSTON.; MR. SUMNER'S RESPONSES. IMMENSE OUTPOURING OF THE PEOPLE. ADDRESSES OF WELCOME BY GOVERNOR GARDNER AND HON. JOSIAH QUINOY.

docs.lead_paragraph: This day CHAS. SUMNER, despite the wishes of his physician and the entreaties of his friends, abandoned the retreat to, which his exhausting illness had rendered his removal necessary, and returned to Boston for the purpose of casting his vote, on Tuesday morning, for Freedom and FREMONT.

headline.main: SOUTHERN POLITICS.; The Reopening of the Slave-Trade--Continuation of the Argument: From the Charleston Stanlard.

FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE..; BREAD STUFFS DROOPING. Consols 91 7-8 a 92. ADVANCE IN PRICES. Excitement in the Liverpool Cotton Market. Market. Arrival of the Canadian at Quebec. Rupture Between the Western Powers and Naples. IMPORTANT FINANCIAL NEWS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The scrow steamship Canadian arrived here this morning, bringing Liverpool dates to the 2ed alt. The steamship Canada arrived out at noon on the 19th alt. The news, commercially speaking, is of considerable importance. It was reported that Lord PALMERSTON was preparing a new Reform Bill, and that Lord JOHN RUSSELL

docs.lead_paragraph: The rapid increase in the consumption of paper, especially in this country, is well known, but its whole extent may not fairly, be anticipated. The amount of paper produced annually in France, is about 150,000,000 pounds, of which 17,000,000 pounds, of which 16,000,000 are sent abroad, and 161,000,000 used at home.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. mail Steamship Cahawba, J. D. BULLOCK Commander, From New-Orleans via Havana, arrived last night. She left New-Orleans on the morning of the 26th, and arrived at Havana on the 25th, at ?? A, M. After coating left on the 29th, at 5 P. M. There is quite a dearth of news at the latter place Health good.
